title: WESTCOAST / MORELL
description: Morell, the husband of Lena, is a cryptozoologist trying to find the Insulindian phasmid.

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Oh, hello, officer." He covers his..."
dialogueTree.text: "Oh, hello, officer." He covers his mouth, struggling to suppress a coughing fit.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""There, there, dear." She gently to..."
links.text: "There, there, dear." She gently touches her husband's arm. "Don't talk too much. And have some more tea."

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for a suspect. Have yo..."
links.text: "I'm looking for a suspect. Have you seen anyone who appeared to be on the run?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I'm afraid not, officer. I've been..."
links.text: "I'm afraid not, officer. I've been busy digging around in the reeds for days, looking for signs of insect activity -- I'm less interested in mammalian concerns, to be perfectly honest."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant takes a short note i..."
links.text: The lieutenant takes a short note in his notebook, then gestures for you to proceed.

links.title: You: ""So I checked all the traps.""
links.text: "So I checked all the traps."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Good, okay..." He breaks his calm...."
links.text: "Good, okay..." He breaks his calm. "*And?*"

links.title: You: ""And one of them was *empty*.""
links.text: "And one of them was *empty*."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""*Completely* empty?" The cryptozoo..."
links.text: "*Completely* empty?" The cryptozoologist's eyes grow wide.

links.title: Half Light: "Surprise -- tempered with fear and..."
links.text: Surprise -- tempered with fear and trepidation. He doesn't know what to think yet. Maybe you're joking?

links.title: You: ""Yes, there was nothing in the trap..."
links.text: "Yes, there was nothing in the trap. No locusts, no phasmid."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""No locusts... but no phasmid eithe..."
links.text: "No locusts... but no phasmid either..."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""That's not *ideal*, but..." He rub..."
links.text: "That's not *ideal*, but..." He rubs his chin.

links.title: You: ""The empty trap was the one at your..."
links.text: "The empty trap was the one at your campsite. Maybe this factors into it somehow?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I definitely left that one stocked..."
links.text: "I definitely left that one stocked. Hmm..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Right from the camp site..." The o..."
links.text: "Right from the camp site..." The old woman's face lights up. "It just means the Insulindian phasmid is even more clever than we thought!"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "The old woman's face lights up. "It..."
links.text: The old woman's face lights up. "It just means the Insulindian phasmid is even more clever than we thought!"

links.title: Rhetoric: "She's engaging in a well-known self..."
links.text: She's engaging in a well-known self-deception called "motivated reasoning." You should *correct* them.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course," the detective whispers..."
links.text: "Of course," the detective whispers to himself. "More clever..."

links.title: Suggestion: "You're dealing with a subject near..."
links.text: You're dealing with a subject near and dear to their hearts. It might behove you to tread *lightly*.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes! The *phantasmodea* picked off..."
links.text: "Yes! The *phantasmodea* picked off the locusts and escaped. This is good news! Though we'll have to reconsider the design of the traps, make them *more* secure..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: "His companion sighs. "Another trip..."
links.text: His companion sighs. "Another trip to the reeds..."

links.title: You: ""Yes. That's *exactly* what it is...."
links.text: "Yes. That's *exactly* what it is. What a deft hunter, this phasmid!"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Of course -- be *sarcastic*." He m..."
links.text: "Of course -- be *sarcastic*." He misinterprets your words. "Unless you have an *alternative* hypothesis you'd like to venture, mine stands, okay?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Actually, no..." His tone changes...."
links.text: "Actually, no..." His tone changes. "Excuse me for getting emotional, this is a big deal for us. You've helped us *twice* now -- and brought some great news, too. My gratitude, *and* the gratitude of the Société Cryptozoologique de Revachol, is yours."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Heartfelt gratitude -- but does it..."
links.text: Heartfelt gratitude -- but does it feel like closure? What *really* happened?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Some kind of foul play might be afo..."
links.text: Some kind of foul play might be afoot. Theft?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you, it's an honour," he say..."
links.text: "Thank you, it's an honour," he says with a straight face, then turns to you. "We should probably return to our *main* investigation here. This has been refreshing, but..."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "...helping cryptozoologists isn't r..."
links.text: ...helping cryptozoologists isn't really a priority for our organization, is it? The lieutenant looks out the window, impatiently.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Dammit lieutenant, have you no inte..."
links.text: Dammit lieutenant, have you no intellectual curiosity?

links.title: You: ""It's not very *scientific* to reas..."
links.text: "It's not very *scientific* to reason backward from a conclusion you *want* to be true."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Hmph. I appreciate your concern, *..."
links.text: "Hmph. I appreciate your concern, *officer*, but please leave this to the *experts*. Unless you have an *alternative* hypothesis you'd like to venture..."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You're jabbing at the soft underbel..."
links.text: You're jabbing at the soft underbelly of his psyche. He realizes he's gotten defensive.

links.title: You: ""I don't know. I'm not persuaded.""
links.text: "I don't know. I'm not persuaded."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Why don't *you* try convincing Mor..."
links.text: "Why don't *you* try convincing Morell his *hypothesis* is invalid?" He scowls.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Thank you for the vote of no-confi..."
links.text: "Thank you for the vote of no-confidence, Gary. And *officer*, I appreciate your concern, but please leave this to the *experts*. Unless you have an *alternative* hypothesis you'd like to venture..."

links.title: You: ""Are you sure you've exhausted all..."
links.text: "Are you sure you've exhausted all the alternative explanations?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: "The cryptozoologist's face flushes..."
links.text: The cryptozoologist's face flushes with indignation. "Of course we have!"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Wait, Morell..." the old woman rai..."
links.text: "Wait, Morell..." the old woman raises a hand. "He may have a point. We have an obligation to rule out other hypotheses..."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""You're right, dear." His face rela..."
links.text: "You're right, dear." His face relaxes. "It's a fair point. But what other explanation could there be?" He turns to you.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Pardon me. This is... a big deal f..."
links.text: "Pardon me. This is... a big deal for us. You've helped us *twice* now -- and brought great news too. My gratitude, *and* the gratitude of the Société Cryptozoologique de Revachol, is yours."

links.title: You: ""Nothing. Nothing. Maybe I didn't c..."
links.text: "Nothing. Nothing. Maybe I didn't check them after all..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Sweetie, you'll give Morell a hear..."
links.text: "Sweetie, you'll give Morell a heart attack. This is no laughing matter for us..."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I'm fine, Lena..." He coughs. "And..."
links.text: "I'm fine, Lena..." He coughs. "And I definitely won't have a heart attack. Rather a cough fit..."

links.title: You: ""No but really -- I *did* check all..."
links.text: "No but really -- I *did* check all the traps."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes-yes -- *and*?""
links.text: "Yes-yes -- *and*?"

links.title: You: ""I had a chat with this kid, Cuno...."
links.text: "I had a chat with this kid, Cuno. He promised to stop stealing the locusts."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""So it *was* just a child..." He pu..."
links.text: "So it *was* just a child..." He purses his lips, crestfallen.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Thank you for telling us, sweetie...."
links.text: "Thank you for telling us, sweetie." She turns to smile gently up at her husband. "This is good news, right? It means we can try *again*."

links.title: Drama: "She acts chipper, but something's c..."
links.text: She acts chipper, but something's changed in her tone. A hidden worry.

links.title: Volition: "Something is secretly gnawing at he..."
links.text: Something is secretly gnawing at her confidence. It's not this Cuno kid, or the missing locusts, it's something else.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes, you're right. We just need to..."
links.text: "Yes, you're right. We just need to restock the empty trap. Then we'll need to inspect the traps one more time, and then *maybe*... we can..."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: "The ageing cryptozoologist breaks i..."
links.text: The ageing cryptozoologist breaks into a hideous coughing fit.

links.title: Composure: "He has a 38 degree fever. His resil..."
links.text: He has a 38 degree fever. His resilience has given way.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "She looks at him with tender concer..."
links.text: She looks at him with tender concern. "Darling, I told you to take it easy. You're getting sick. Maybe it's time to go home?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""You're right, you're right..." He..."
links.text: "You're right, you're right..." He breathes carefully, not to start coughing again. "We can come back next season... when it's warmer..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "That's just something people tell t..."
links.text: That's just something people tell themselves when they fail.

links.title: Authority: "There won't be a next season. Not f..."
links.text: There won't be a next season. Not for this. Find the phasmid or admit defeat, people.

links.title: Endurance: "More cardio? Let's *do* this."
links.text: More cardio? Let's *do* this.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Thank you for telling us, sweetie...."
links.text: "Thank you for telling us, sweetie." She turns to smile gently up at her husband. "This is good news, right? It means we can try *again*."

links.title: You: ""I found the locusts in a nearby sh..."
links.text: "I found the locusts in a nearby shack. Some kid's built a city of them."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""What the devil is a Cuno? And why..."
links.text: "What the devil is a Cuno? And why would he be making a *city of bugs*?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "A shadow of worry passes over the w..."
links.text: A shadow of worry passes over the woman's face. "Oh, my dear Morell. You've been an old man for too long. Kids love to torment insects, almost as much as they love to torment old folks..."

links.title: You: ""I'll talk to the kids, ask them to..."
links.text: "I'll talk to the kids, ask them to stop. It's probably the two kids in the yard near the shack."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, you've been such a dear to us...."
links.text: "Oh, you've been such a dear to us. Please, let us know. If the kids can stop hampering us... I have a feeling we're getting *so* close!"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Well, I see you've got all the hel..."
links.text: "Well, I see you've got all the help you need." The man turns to his companions. "I'll see you tonight at my place -- let's play 'Suzerainty' -- but no more field trips for me."

links.title: Authority: "This is a slippery one -- he may re..."
links.text: This is a slippery one -- he may respect the law, but mostly wants to pass under the radar. You won't get a chance to talk after you walk out of here.

links.title: Drama: "He hasn't been particularly forthco..."
links.text: He hasn't been particularly forthcoming before. He may well still be hiding something. After he's left it's too late.

links.title: Logic: "After this is your last chance to t..."
links.text: After this is your last chance to talk to Gary.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Really, Gary?" The woman's voice i..."
links.text: "Really, Gary?" The woman's voice is a little shaky suddenly. "We're *getting* somewhere here. I'd love to play 'Suzerainty', but..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Lena, I'm sorry, but you're not *g..."
links.text: "Lena, I'm sorry, but you're not *getting* anywhere, it was some kids. I know the little mutants around here -- leave anything out in the open and they'll steal it. Even if it's bugs." He looks at his tea.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Morell, it's been fun, really. But..."
links.text: "Morell, it's been fun, really. But I need a bath and I have deliveries to handle. When this tea is done, I gotta run."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""No-no. No need to apologize, Gary...."
links.text: "No-no. No need to apologize, Gary. You've been more than helpful. We'll have to take a rain check on that game of 'Suzerainty' today though -- we're gonna follow this through."

links.title: Composure: "He keeps the language unemotional b..."
links.text: He keeps the language unemotional but it's in there -- disappointment.

links.title: Authority: "The first man to break formation is..."
links.text: The first man to break formation is always a blow to leadership. This is bigger than he lets on.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""What the devil... Why would kids b..."
links.text: "What the devil... Why would kids be making a *city of bugs*?"

links.title: You: "Develop an alternative theory about..."
links.text: Develop an alternative theory about the missing locusts.

links.title: Interfacing: "There's no mystery here. You've see..."
links.text: There's no mystery here. You've seen the Locust City and its spiralling mud towers. All that's left is to confront the city father himself...

links.title: You: ""I'm pretty sure it was Cuno who to..."
links.text: "I'm pretty sure it was Cuno who took the locusts. He's built a whole city for them in his shack."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""What the devil is a Cuno? And why..."
links.text: "What the devil is a Cuno? And why would he be making a *city of bugs*?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "A shadow of worry passes over the w..."
links.text: A shadow of worry passes over the woman's face. "Oh, my dear Morell. You've been an old man for too long. Kids love to torment insects, almost as much as they love to torment old folks..."

links.title: You: ""I'll look around and see if the ki..."
links.text: "I'll look around and see if the kids in Martinaise know anything."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Delinquents -- my favourite." It d..."
links.text: "Delinquents -- my favourite." It doesn't sound like it's really his favourite.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, you've been such a dear to us...."
links.text: "Oh, you've been such a dear to us. Please, let us know whatever you turn up. I have a feeling we're getting *so* close!"

links.title: Interfacing: "Consider the way the empty trap was..."
links.text: Consider the way the empty trap was disturbed, as though *shaken*. Most likely the hands of a young person -- hands small enough to fit inside the trap too.

links.title: Logic: "You should ask the redheaded boy. C..."
links.text: You should ask the redheaded boy. Cuno.

links.title: You: ""I have a feeling some local kids m..."
links.text: "I have a feeling some local kids may have stolen the locusts."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Kids? What would a *child* want wi..."
links.text: "Kids? What would a *child* want with bugs?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "But whose?"
links.text: But whose?

links.title: Interfacing: "You look down at your hands, but th..."
links.text: You look down at your hands, but they don't have anything to tell you.

links.title: You: ""Here's an idea. Maybe the locusts..."
links.text: "Here's an idea. Maybe the locusts ate *themselves*?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""*Autocannibalistic locusts*? I app..."
links.text: "*Autocannibalistic locusts*? I appreciate your *unconventional* thinking, officer, but really, cryptids aren't your area of expertise."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's okay, dear. *Most* hypotheses..."
links.text: "It's okay, dear. *Most* hypotheses turn out to be false."

links.title: You: ""Maybe it was a *different* cryptid..."
links.text: "Maybe it was a *different* cryptid who took the bugs?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""A *different* cryptid?" The crypto..."
links.text: "A *different* cryptid?" The cryptozoologist furrows his heavy brow.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, sweetie. Maybe you should stic..."
links.text: "Oh, sweetie. Maybe you should stick to human detective work?"

links.title: You: ""Okay. I've been thinking and I'm j..."
links.text: "Okay. I've been thinking and I'm just not sure that it was the *phasmid* that took the locusts."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Really, officer, we can take it fr..."
links.text: "Really, officer, we can take it from here." The cryptozoologist furrows his heavy brow.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes, sweetie, we've already taken..."
links.text: "Yes, sweetie, we've already taken too much of your time."

links.title: Interfacing: "You have your suspicions, but nothi..."
links.text: You have your suspicions, but nothing you can form into a *viable explanation*.

links.title: You: ""Tell me about this *phasmid* you'r..."
links.text: "Tell me about this *phasmid* you're looking for."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Hmm! Well, first of all it's damn..."
links.text: "Hmm! Well, first of all it's damn difficult to find -- which is why we've been knee-deep in the reeds laying traps for it."

links.title: You: ""What makes it so difficult to find?""
links.text: "What makes it so difficult to find?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Good question. Being a phasmid, of..."
links.text: "Good question. Being a phasmid, of the order *phantasmodea* -- a ghost insect -- it disguises itself as plant-matter. In this case the reeds..." He looks around. "Awful lot of reeds around, aren't there?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""*And*, I suspect it may also have..."
links.text: "*And*, I suspect it may also have developed other *specialized techniques* to protect itself from predators... or scientists, in our present case."

links.title: You: ""What sorts of *specialized techniq..."
links.text: "What sorts of *specialized techniques* is the phasmid using to hide itself?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""It's my hypothesis that it has evo..."
links.text: "It's my hypothesis that it has evolved certain electro-chemical defences that allow it to interfere with animal perception -- impeding pattern recognition, confusing the visual cortex."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""But I cannot describe how these de..."
links.text: "But I cannot describe how these defences work -- much less how they evolved -- without studying a live specimen."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes, it makes perfect sense. You're..."
links.text: Yes, it makes perfect sense. You're beginning to suspect there's something *para-natural* about this phasmid.

links.title: Conceptualization: "A *ghost insect*, he said? These pe..."
links.text: A *ghost insect*, he said? These people are looking for a ghost.

links.title: You: ""Ghost insect... so you're ghost hu..."
links.text: "Ghost insect... so you're ghost hunters."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""No -- that is precisely what we're..."
links.text: "No -- that is precisely what we're *not*. We are zoological specialists, looking for an extant species of phasmid."

links.title: You: ""How big is this phasmid?""
links.text: "How big is this phasmid?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I'm expecting it to be quite giant..."
links.text: "I'm expecting it to be quite giant. One known species of phasmid, called the *megaphasmodea zhouensis*, is about the size of a grown man's forearm. So..." He leaves the conclusion up to you.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Seems puny, to be honest."
links.text: Seems puny, to be honest.

links.title: You: ""Why are you so interested in this..."
links.text: "Why are you so interested in this stick bug? Aren't there more sensational animals out there?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Typical rookie assumption." He fla..."
links.text: "Typical rookie assumption." He flashes you a sideways smile. "Insects are much more sophisticated creatures than those unversed in zoology give them credit for."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Even simply catching a glimpse of..."
links.text: "Even simply catching a glimpse of the Insulindian phasmid would be the apex of my -- of *any* -- cryptozoologist's career. But to study it and its defences, find out how it's stayed hidden so long..." He shakes his head.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "...would be *glory* itself."
links.text: ...would be *glory* itself.

links.title: You: ""Why are you so interested in this..."
links.text: "Why are you so interested in this stick bug? It doesn't seem to be as colourful as some of the other cryptids I've heard about."

links.title: You: ""What have you discovered about it..."
links.text: "What have you discovered about it so far?" (Continue.)

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Very little, I'm sorry to say. No..."
links.text: "Very little, I'm sorry to say. No one's ever captured a specimen, so all our information is based on first- and third-hand accounts."

links.title: You: ""So no one's ever found one?""
links.text: "So no one's ever found one?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Not *yet*" He holds up an index fi..."
links.text: "Not *yet*" He holds up an index finger. "That's what makes it a *cryptid*.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Khm..." The lieutenant interjects...."
links.text: "Khm..." The lieutenant interjects. "Just out of curiosity -- if there's no proof of its existence, how do you know it's real?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I *know* it's real," the cryptozoo..."
links.text: "I *know* it's real," the cryptozoologist says, brusquely enough that even he seems taken aback by it...

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's clear that his obsession with..."
links.text: It's clear that his obsession with the phasmid is driven by something more than the pure pursuit of scientific advancement.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""By which I mean," he says, gatheri..."
links.text: "By which I mean," he says, gathering himself, "I've heard enough first-hand accounts to believe quite firmly that the Insulindian phasmid is more than mere superstition."

links.title: Empathy: "What would it be like to grasp and..."
links.text: What would it be like to grasp and hold onto something you think is next to you -- or just behind you -- like a trace of vapour you exhaled one spring morning as a child? This is what he's searching for. A spectre.

links.title: You: ""Lena said there has been a sightin..."
links.text: "Lena said there has been a sighting of it, here in Martinaise."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes, the most *recent* sighting wa..."
links.text: "Yes, the most *recent* sighting was by a couple of teenagers along the coast here. That's what brought us to Martinaise specifically."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""It's the first credible sighting i..."
links.text: "It's the first credible sighting in several decades. Admittedly, it's an unusual location for this species, but with all the sewage run-off upstream, it probably doesn't matter much anymore."

links.title: You: ""What makes you think the phasmid i..."
links.text: "What makes you think the phasmid is here in Martinaise?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""There was a credible sighting here..."
links.text: "There was a credible sighting here recently. A pair of teenagers described a creature that matched the Insulindian phasmid to an *uncanny* degree, *despite* not knowing what it was themselves."

links.title: You: ""Maybe the Insulindian phasmid has...."
links.text: "Maybe the Insulindian phasmid has... died out?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I have to resist the thought." He..."
links.text: "I have to resist the thought." He shakes his head vigorously. "Such an extraordinary creature is doubtlessly *highly resilient*. After all, it's generally thought to be capable of parthenogenesis."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "He means asexual reproduction. The..."
links.text: He means asexual reproduction. The females of the species don't need to mate to produce viable eggs. This makes it easier for a species with a small population to survive.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Uhm..."
links.text: Uhm...

links.title: You: ""That's pretty clever!""
links.text: "That's pretty clever!"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes, the Insulindian phasmid is a..."
links.text: "Yes, the Insulindian phasmid is a *very* clever insect -- that's why it's so damn difficult to catch! But as a scientist, I try my best to remain dispassionate."

links.title: Composure: "There's nothing *dispassionate* abo..."
links.text: There's nothing *dispassionate* about the way he talks about the insect.

links.title: You: ""The male is a deficient life form...."
links.text: "The male is a deficient life form. The world would be better off if women didn't need men to reproduce."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Nature does not concern herself wi..."
links.text: "Nature does not concern herself with ethical propositions. As a scientist, my interest is *strictly dispassionate*."

links.title: You: ""Females reproducing without males!..."
links.text: "Females reproducing without males!? A travesty. A crime against passion *and* common sense."

links.title: You: ""This arouses no special feelings i..."
links.text: "This arouses no special feelings in me."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""And it shouldn't. Nature does not..."
links.text: "And it shouldn't. Nature does not concern herself with ethical propositions. As a scientist, my interest is *strictly dispassionate*."

links.title: You: ""Par...the...no...genesis?""
links.text: "Par...the...no...genesis?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes. The females don't need males..."
links.text: "Yes. The females don't need males to reproduce. Makes it easier for a species to survive in adverse conditions."

links.title: You: ""Got it. Parthonosis.""
links.text: "Got it. Parthonosis."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Parthe-no-genesis. Meaning the fem..."
links.text: "Parthe-no-genesis. Meaning the females don't need males to reproduce. Makes it easier for a species to survive in adverse conditions."

links.title: You: ""But if no one can prove it exists,..."
links.text: "But if no one can prove it exists, how do you know it's real?"

links.title: You: ""Tell me more about these traps.""
links.text: "Tell me more about these traps."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Well..." He points at the cage of..."
links.text: "Well..." He points at the cage of mesh and wiring on the ground. "They may not *look* impressive, but Lena designed them quite cleverly, so I'm sure they'll do the trick."

links.title: You: ""Lena designed the traps?""
links.text: "Lena designed the traps?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes," he says with some pride."
links.text: "Yes," he says with some pride.

links.title: Suggestion: "More than some. He admires this abo..."
links.text: More than some. He admires this about her.

links.title: You: ""How do the traps work?""
links.text: "How do the traps work?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Simple -- attracted by the locusts..."
links.text: "Simple -- attracted by the locusts, the phasmid crawls down the funnel, and, having eaten its fill, can't get back out."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""At least, that's the intention. Th..."
links.text: "At least, that's the intention. The net isn't a perfect solution, but we didn't want to use anything that might damage the specimen's delicate exoskeleton."

links.title: You: ""What are you using as bait?""
links.text: "What are you using as bait?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Locusts." He gestures toward the t..."
links.text: "Locusts." He gestures toward the trap. "Nearly all *known* phasmids are herbivores, of course, but we've hypothesized that the Insulindian phasmid might occasionally prey on other insects."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Inside the traps, a number of locus..."
links.text: Inside the traps, a number of locusts crawl and tumble over one another in a tiny, chittering swarm.

links.title: Logic: "A meat-eating stick insect? Does it..."
links.text: A meat-eating stick insect? Does it pretend to be the reeds as part of it's ambush behaviour? This seems unlikely.

links.title: You: ""A carnivorous stick insect? Seems..."
links.text: "A carnivorous stick insect? Seems unlikely."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Thank you for your opinion. We hav..."
links.text: "Thank you for your opinion. We have also included plant material in the traps -- to satiate your *scepticism*."

links.title: Suggestion: "Not a big fan of scepticism, this o..."
links.text: Not a big fan of scepticism, this one.

links.title: You: ""What will you do if these traps do..."
links.text: "What will you do if these traps don't work?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""They'll *work*, I assure you. The..."
links.text: "They'll *work*, I assure you. The predatory hypothesis -- using locusts as bait -- accounts for the failure of previous efforts by other teams, which used plants. We have given this some thought."

links.title: Interfacing: "The traps do seem to be deftly and..."
links.text: The traps do seem to be deftly and thoughtfully constructed. It's clear the cryptozoologist's wife knows what she's doing.

links.title: You: ""Let me ask you about something els..."
links.text: "Let me ask you about something else."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes. What?""
links.text: "Yes. What?"

links.title: You: ""Lena seems pretty eager for you to..."
links.text: "Lena seems pretty eager for you to return."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""By *wöman* you mean my wife, I ass..."
links.text: "By *wöman* you mean my wife, I assume. I will return to her -- but I can't leave before we've finished with these traps."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""My wife understands that just as w..."
links.text: "My wife understands that just as well as anyone." He looks south -- where Lena would be.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""COME ON, MORELL. WE'VE BEEN SOAKIN..."
links.text: "COME ON, MORELL. WE'VE BEEN SOAKING OUT HERE FOR DAYS. IT'S TIME TO GO BACK."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""AND LEAVE THE TRAPS? ABSOLUTELY NO..."
links.text: "AND LEAVE THE TRAPS? ABSOLUTELY NOT!" he yells in response. "I won't let Lena down..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""COME ON, SHE WANTS US BACK. I'M SO..."
links.text: "COME ON, SHE WANTS US BACK. I'M SOAKED UP TO MY NUTS OVER HERE. WE'LL BOTH CATCH REED CRABS IF WE DON'T DRY OUT SOON."

links.title: Empathy: "Won't *let Lena down*? Sounds like..."
links.text: Won't *let Lena down*? Sounds like the cryptozoologist's wife shares a *special connection* to the phasmid somehow...

links.title: You: ""I didn't know the phasmid was so i..."
links.text: "I didn't know the phasmid was so important to Lena."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Of course it's important to her, s..."
links.text: "Of course it's important to her, she's *seen* it. A verified sighting, on record, one of only four this century and it's hers."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "She's *seen* it?"
links.text: She's *seen* it?

links.title: You: ""Really? She's *sighted* the phasmi..."
links.text: "Really? She's *sighted* the phasmid? She didn't tell me that."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes. That's... how we first came t..."
links.text: "Yes. That's... how we first came to know one another, in fact. But that's *her* story to tell, not mine." He coughs, then continues...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Needless to say, you *must* ask her..."
links.text: Needless to say, you *must* ask her about the mysterious phasmid.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Suffice to say, it's long been our..."
links.text: "Suffice to say, it's long been our dream to find proof of the Insulindian phasmid *together*. I can't abandon course now." Another cough, into his fist this time.

links.title: Endurance: "His spirit may be willing, but his..."
links.text: His spirit may be willing, but his body might be too old to endure the rigours of the coast.

links.title: You: ""Maybe you could go back to the Whi..."
links.text: "Maybe you could go back to the Whirling, warm up, come back to check the traps *later*?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""No, no, no. The traps need to be m..."
links.text: "No, no, no. The traps need to be monitored on a regular schedule. What would we do if the phasmid were to *starve* while we were sipping tea at the hostel?"

links.title: Volition: "He's dead set on this."
links.text: He's dead set on this.

links.title: You: ""You should just give up on this bu..."
links.text: "You should just give up on this bug hunt."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""*Give up*? After we've come so far..."
links.text: "*Give up*? After we've come so far? Not a chance!"

links.title: You: ""Okay. I understand. I don't give u..."
links.text: "Okay. I understand. I don't give up on things either."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Good. A good quality to have -- bo..."
links.text: "Good. A good quality to have -- both for a police officer *and* an experimental zoologist."

links.title: Interfacing: "Hmm... I could go for some trap-set..."
links.text: Hmm... I could go for some trap-setting.

links.title: You: ""Really? She's *sighted* the phasmi..."
links.text: "Really? She's *sighted* the phasmid?"

links.title: You: ""C'mon. You're doing this for yours..."
links.text: "C'mon. You're doing this for yourself, not her."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I'm doing this for *science*. And..."
links.text: "I'm doing this for *science*. And so is she."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""And I'm eager to return to her, I..."
links.text: "And I'm eager to return to her, I assure you -- but I can't leave before we've finished with these traps."

links.title: You: ""What if I checked the traps for yo..."
links.text: "What if I checked the traps for you?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I didn't expect you to take such a..."
links.text: "I didn't expect you to take such an interest in our work here, officer." He looks at you with obvious surprise.

links.title: You: ""Cryptozoology and detective work a..."
links.text: "Cryptozoology and detective work are very similar."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes, indeed! Both require a great..."
links.text: "Yes, indeed! Both require a great deal of research, attention to detail, and, above all, *persistence*."

links.title: You: ""Where are these traps?""
links.text: "Where are these traps?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""There are four in total. One is to..."
links.text: "There are four in total. One is to the south, on this little peninsula -- by the boat houses there." He points south. "It's very near."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Another we set in Land's End, to t..."
links.text: "Another we set in Land's End, to the northeast. It's behind a small sand dune there, on your way to the old radio tower. After the church."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""The third is set near the canal, w..."
links.text: "The third is set near the canal, where you crossed. By a concrete slab. A big thicket of reeds going up the slope, and among them..." He gestures to the trap in front of him.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""You should check at least one of t..."
links.text: "You should check at least one of those before returning to *this* one, since I just set it. This one's more of a *technicality*, but still... better safe and stupid than sorry."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Be careful where you tread in the r..."
links.text: Be careful where you tread in the reeds. Some less conscientious researchers may have left their traps out there -- armed, hidden.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That seems like a lot. Do we reall..."
links.text: "That seems like a lot. Do we really have time for this... extracurricular venture?"

links.title: You: ""But, Kim, maybe our suspect is hid..."
links.text: "But, Kim, maybe our suspect is hiding out in the reeds along with the traps?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The man surveys the cold coast. "I..."
links.text: The man surveys the cold coast. "I have a feeling the only people foolish enough to spend their time skulking among the reeds are these poor fools... and us. But fine. It's not like we're drowning in leads."

links.title: You: ""The pursuit of knowledge is its ow..."
links.text: "The pursuit of knowledge is its own justification."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Is it?" he doesn't look too convin..."
links.text: "Is it?" he doesn't look too convinced but the small shrug indicates -- why not?

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "If you think it's important -- you..."
links.text: If you think it's important -- you *have* been right before.

links.title: You: ""What? Aren't you having *fun*?""
links.text: "What? Aren't you having *fun*?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Even relative to examining a week-..."
links.text: "Even relative to examining a week-old corpse, I'm not sure mucking about in the reeds qualifies as *fun*... but have it your way, detective..."

links.title: You: ""What do I do if there's a phasmid..."
links.text: "What do I do if there's a phasmid in one of the traps?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Bring it to me at once. Just make..."
links.text: "Bring it to me at once. Just make sure the trap is closed tight."

links.title: Drama: "He's not comfortable with the possi..."
links.text: He's not comfortable with the possibility that you'll claim the find -- but he's lying about this even to himself.

links.title: You: ""What if I encounter the phasmid in..."
links.text: "What if I encounter the phasmid in the wild?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""That's *highly* unlikely, officer...."
links.text: "That's *highly* unlikely, officer. But, in the event you do..." He takes out a small white spray can. "I'll spray you with a pheromone mixture I developed."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Did you hear that -- pheromones! Yo..."
links.text: Did you hear that -- pheromones! You were right about the teenagers...

links.title: You: ""So it really *was* the phasmid tha..."
links.text: "So it really *was* the phasmid that made the teenagers make out..."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Oh, I *doubt* there's any connecti..."
links.text: "Oh, I *doubt* there's any connection there. Anyway, these pheromones will attract the insect to you, or at least prevent it from bolting at the sight of you. It's quite potent, should last you about a week."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""It's made of musk and research che..."
links.text: "It's made of musk and research chemicals. The pheromones *should* attract the insect to you, or at least prevent it from bolting at the sight of you. It's quite potent, will last you about a week."

links.title: You: ""Lay it on me.""
links.text: "Lay it on me."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: "He douses you with the odd-smelling..."
links.text: He douses you with the odd-smelling spray and then gives you a satisfied nod.

links.title: You: ""Lay it on me -- thick." (Present y..."
links.text: "Lay it on me -- thick." (Present your arm pit.)

links.title: You: ""I don't want this, thank you very..."
links.text: "I don't want this, thank you very much."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Your choice." He puts the spray ba..."
links.text: "Your choice." He puts the spray back in his pocket. "As I said, the chances of you encountering the phasmid are next to zero."

links.title: Inland Empire: "But you... you *feel* you should ha..."
links.text: But you... you *feel* you should have it on you. Something bad might happen.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Don't mess around, take the pheromo..."
links.text: Don't mess around, take the pheromone, it'll make you sexier.

links.title: You: ""I've changed my mind. Spray me wit..."
links.text: "I've changed my mind. Spray me with lots of pheromone." (Present your arm pit)

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: "He douses you with the odd-smelling..."
links.text: He douses you with the odd-smelling spray -- a double helping as you present your other arm pit -- and then gives you a satisfied nod.

links.title: Shivers: "This is the smell of dying reeds, o..."
links.text: This is the smell of dying reeds, of longing crumbling into the water.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "It's not so different from the putr..."
links.text: It's not so different from the putrefaction of the hanged man, actually.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant wrinkles his nose. "..."
links.text: The lieutenant wrinkles his nose. "I hope you're not buying this. He dispenses it without letting you touch the canister, so it would be precious, like holy water..."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""It *is* precious. A single dose co..."
links.text: "It *is* precious. A single dose cost me 50 reál to develop. Not that I expect *you* to understand self-financing one's own research." He looks at the lieutenant with disdain, then puts the spray back in his pocket.

links.title: You: ""I'm ready. Let's get to it." (Conc..."
links.text: "I'm ready. Let's get to it." (Conclude.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right. Which means you two can pac..."
links.text: "Right. Which means you two can pack up and go back to the Whirling."

links.title: Empathy: "Whatever he thinks about this detou..."
links.text: Whatever he thinks about this detour, it's clear that these men are exhausted and in need of assistance.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""FINALLY! Someone's talking sense!""
links.text: "FINALLY! Someone's talking sense!"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Thank you for your help. Gary and..."
links.text: "Thank you for your help. Gary and I will start breaking down camp. If you have any more questions, now's the time to ask! We'll be gone once you get to it."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Thank you for your help. Gary and..."
links.text: "Thank you for your help. Gary and I will start breaking down camp. If you have any more questions, now's the time to ask!"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Finally, you're being sensible! I'..."
links.text: "Finally, you're being sensible! I'll start packing right now."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "What about his eager-to-leave frien..."
links.text: What about his eager-to-leave friend Gary there? Talk to him too, perhaps.

links.title: Rhetoric: "If it's more cryptid-related busine..."
links.text: If it's more cryptid-related business you want to discuss, you'll have time for that later too.

links.title: Inland Empire: "But what if the information is vita..."
links.text: But what if the information is vital -- on *the hunt*...

links.title: You: ""Chaos is my method. I am its scion.""
links.text: "Chaos is my method. I am its scion."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Well..." He doesn't know what to s..."
links.text: "Well..." He doesn't know what to say. "Be that as it may, I'd really appreciate the help!"

links.title: You: ""We're looking for someone hiding o..."
links.text: "We're looking for someone hiding on this very coast. Looking for *another* thing may lead us to her."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why not?" The lieutenant shrugs. "..."
links.text: "Why not?" The lieutenant shrugs. "At least it will give us the excuse to look into a *lot* of reeds."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""That it will." The man cracks an u..."
links.text: "That it will." The man cracks an unwieldy smile. "That it *absolutely* will. I hope you brought your good boots."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Sometimes it's helpful to take a b..."
links.text: "Sometimes it's helpful to take a break and return to one's *primary pursuit* with fresh eyes." He nods.

links.title: You: ""I'm *all in* with this cryptid shi..."
links.text: "I'm *all in* with this cryptid shit. I'm hooked."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Caught the bug, I see." He cracks..."
links.text: "Caught the bug, I see." He cracks an unwieldy smile. "It's easier to get caught up in the *search* than you'd imagine."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""My partner was joking," he says, u..."
links.text: "My partner was joking," he says, unsure of himself. "We're on a search of our own. It wouldn't hurt to check the reeds while we're at it... I assume that's what we'll be doing?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Oh yes, officer. Very much so. The..."
links.text: "Oh yes, officer. Very much so. The traps are all in the reeds -- that is where we expect the phasmid to prowl."

links.title: You: ""How did you become a *cryptozoolog..."
links.text: "How did you become a *cryptozoologist*?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""It's truly not that special. What..."
links.text: "It's truly not that special. What is *cryptozoology* anyway? A derogative. I just like puzzles, like any scientist."

links.title: You: ""So you're living your childhood dr..."
links.text: "So you're living your childhood dream out here."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""It's not child's play just because..."
links.text: "It's not child's play just because I have to traipse through the mud every so often." His eyes narrow.

links.title: Endurance: "He takes the dangers and discomfort..."
links.text: He takes the dangers and discomforts that come with his work for granted, but just imagine the unforgiving desert heat he's endured, the wetlands filled with venomous reptiles he has crossed...

links.title: You: "I'm the most rugged of men. That so..."
links.text: I'm the most rugged of men. That sounds like my kind of fun.

links.title: Endurance: "You could get a heat stroke and fai..."
links.text: You could get a heat stroke and faint and hurt your head. You could get bitten by a snake. You could get beaten up for trespassing.

links.title: You: "Suffering will only make me stronge..."
links.text: Suffering will only make me stronger.

links.title: Endurance: "It's probably this way of thinking..."
links.text: It's probably this way of thinking that got you where you are.

links.title: You: "That's pretty much where I am right..."
links.text: That's pretty much where I am right now.

links.title: Endurance: "It could be worse. So much worse."
links.text: It could be worse. So much worse.

links.title: You: "I don't know how he does it. I *alr..."
links.text: I don't know how he does it. I *already* want a bath.

links.title: Endurance: "With nice bath salts, to soothe you..."
links.text: With nice bath salts, to soothe your bruised and battered soul.

links.title: You: "Seems silly to expend so much effor..."
links.text: Seems silly to expend so much effort on studying stuff that *isn't even real*.

links.title: Endurance: "Absolutely. You'd never do somethin..."
links.text: Absolutely. You'd never do something like that to yourself, nope.

links.title: You: ""Why not just be a zoologist? Real..."
links.text: "Why not just be a zoologist? Real animals are puzzling too."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""*Real*..." He scoffs at the concep..."
links.text: "*Real*..." He scoffs at the concept. "I know you think one is a respectable profession while the other is superstition, everyone does!"

links.title: You: ""I don't. It's a profession, just l..."
links.text: "I don't. It's a profession, just like any other."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Indeed. My methods do not differ f..."
links.text: "Indeed. My methods do not differ from other scientists, I simply draw upon a wider variety of evidence, and I have more hope that something truly surprising might happen."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Your nerve endings tell you there i..."
links.text: Your nerve endings tell you there is no such thing as a *positive* surprise.

links.title: You: ""Life's surprises are mostly misera..."
links.text: "Life's surprises are mostly miserable."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Agreed. Yet there is always a chan..."
links.text: "Agreed. Yet there is always a chance, albeit a small one, of a truly *good* surprise. One simply needs to look at the history of science -- serendipities abound!"

links.title: You: ""And has anything 'truly surprising..."
links.text: "And has anything 'truly surprising' ever happened to you?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I have yet to *catch* a cryptid, i..."
links.text: "I have yet to *catch* a cryptid, if that's what you're getting at, but I have come close."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Hmmm... interesting. Something for..."
links.text: Hmmm... interesting. Something for later. This close call.

links.title: You: ""Honestly -- being a cryptozoologis..."
links.text: "Honestly -- being a cryptozoologist trumps most of the garbage I've seen people do."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Hmh," a hum and a nod. "My methods..."
links.text: "Hmh," a hum and a nod. "My methods do not differ from other scientists, I simply draw upon a wider variety of evidence, and I have more hope that something truly surprising might happen."

links.title: You: ""Cryptozoology does seem like a lot..."
links.text: "Cryptozoology does seem like a lot of wishful thinking."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""My methods are the same as those o..."
links.text: "My methods are the same as those of other scientists, I simply draw upon a wider variety of evidence, and I have more hope that something truly surprising might happen."

links.title: You: ""What kinds of evidence do you use?""
links.text: "What kinds of evidence do you use?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Everything from forgotten regional..."
links.text: "Everything from forgotten regional lore to newspaper accounts like the one that brought us here to look for the phasmid. I keep a very open mind."

links.title: Conceptualization: "He's interested in things that peop..."
links.text: He's interested in things that people believe that scientists don't.

links.title: You: ""You think other scientists don't l..."
links.text: "You think other scientists don't listen to ordinary people enough?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Most *establishment* scientists on..."
links.text: "Most *establishment* scientists only care about reputation and remuneration, not *real* research, and certainly not the truth. They're a cowardly lot, and both *the field* and basement archives can be dangerous places."

links.title: You: ""Have you ever discovered a cryptid?""
links.text: "Have you ever discovered a cryptid?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""No. Very few cryptids are ever dis..."
links.text: "No. Very few cryptids are ever discovered -- and not for a lack of trying. To stay hidden is a cryptid's primary quality. It's even in the *name* cryptid."

links.title: You: ""So how many cryptids have been fou..."
links.text: "So how many cryptids have been found?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Of the list of cryptids kept by th..."
links.text: "Of the list of cryptids kept by the Cryptozoological Society of Chemnie, which is four thousand and eighty two items long, about two thousand have been confirmed as hoaxes."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Two are categorized as 'confirmed..."
links.text: "Two are categorized as 'confirmed discoveries'. The rest are in differing stages of discovery, refutation, and data collection."

links.title: You: ""Only *two* have proven to be real?""
links.text: "Only *two* have proven to be real?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes -- the Shautauquan forest pygm..."
links.text: "Yes -- the Shautauquan forest pygmy who turned out to be an extinct species of primate; and a cave salamander from Yugo-Graad, who is... honestly quite unremarkable. It's in a zoo somewhere..."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""We cryptozoologists are brutally h..."
links.text: "We cryptozoologists are brutally honest with ourselves, more so even than the public. Most cryptids are hoaxes or they are never found. That does not mean we should stop searching."

links.title: You: ""Two out of four thousand is not ev..."
links.text: "Two out of four thousand is not even *one* percent!"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""In fact -- it is 0.05%. Ever more..."
links.text: "In fact -- it is 0.05%. Ever more magnificent, should our search contribute to making that number 0.075%!"

links.title: Logic: "He has clearly done his math on thi..."
links.text: He has clearly done his math on this. There is no surprising him -- or swaying his opinion.

links.title: You: "(Nod approvingly.) "Then the Insuli..."
links.text: (Nod approvingly.) "Then the Insulindian phasmid will be the *third*."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Indeed." He does not smile, just l..."
links.text: "Indeed." He does not smile, just looks you in the eye. It's a forceful gaze. "If our expedition is successful, every paper in the world will report on it. From Revachol to Doushantou -- it will be a zoological miracle."

links.title: Shivers: "The hair on your arms stands up......"
links.text: The hair on your arms stands up... electricity. Sounds like reeds hissing.

links.title: You: ""I don't even know what to say. Tha..."
links.text: "I don't even know what to say. That's a small number of discoveries."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Do you know what the success rate..."
links.text: "Do you know what the success rate in pharmacological research is? 0.000003% of bio-reactive agents have reproducibly beneficial effects. Yet science persists in the search for medicine. *As* we persist in our search for new species."

links.title: You: ""Thanks for explaining that. Now, a..."
links.text: "Thanks for explaining that. Now, about something else." (Conclude.)

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes?""
links.text: "Yes?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I've just always liked animals, an..."
links.text: "I've just always liked animals, and puzzles. Searching for cryptids is a bit of both."

links.title: Suggestion: "He seems reluctant to talk about hi..."
links.text: He seems reluctant to talk about himself, but he'll open up -- if you prod a little.

links.title: You: ""Let's talk about *specific* crypti..."
links.text: "Let's talk about *specific* cryptids."

links.title: You: ""Man, I'm really feeling this is co..."
links.text: "Man, I'm really feeling this is costing me time on my main investigation..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course, sweetie, you've helped..."
links.text: "Of course, sweetie, you've helped us so much already. Everyone would understand if you..."

links.title: You: ""It's not worth risking your health..."
links.text: "It's not worth risking your health. You should call it a day and go home." (Refuse.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""He's right, dear Morell. Come now,..."
links.text: "He's right, dear Morell. Come now, we've waited so long, what's one more season?"

links.title: Drama: "Self-deceit, sire."
links.text: Self-deceit, sire.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""You're right, dear. We'll get our..."
links.text: "You're right, dear. We'll get our shot yet, I'm sure of it..."

links.title: Composure: "The slouch in his shoulders tells y..."
links.text: The slouch in his shoulders tells you otherwise. He doesn't know how many more field expeditions he has left in him...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This place is *much* better for fi..."
links.text: "This place is *much* better for field work in the summer, believe me."

links.title: Empathy: "Is that a pang of sadness, lieutena..."
links.text: Is that a pang of sadness, lieutenant?

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Thank you dear." She bows to the l..."
links.text: "Thank you dear." She bows to the lieutenant -- then turns to you. "And you, detective Fox..." A sad smile. "You've been great company to an old lady and her stubborn husband."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""And you, detective." She turns to..."
links.text: "And you, detective." She turns to you with a sad smile. "You've been great company to an old lady and her stubborn husband. Thank you, truly."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""You're right, Lena. The RCM is wor..."
links.text: "You're right, Lena. The RCM is worth their salt -- more so than they say on the radio."

links.title: You: ""Wait, can I have your address? In..."
links.text: "Wait, can I have your address? In case there's news."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Okay, it's 1113 Tabernacle Road. J..."
links.text: "Okay, it's 1113 Tabernacle Road. Jamrock, but..."

links.title: Empathy: "A sigh. She doesn't think you'll ne..."
links.text: A sigh. She doesn't think you'll need it.

links.title: You: ""Good bye, Lena.""
links.text: "Good bye, Lena."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Good bye." She smiles and they lea..."
links.text: "Good bye." She smiles and they leave -- two old cryptozoologists and one gas-powered wheelchair.

links.title: You: ""See you around, wheels.""
links.text: "See you around, wheels."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You too -- Morell? Let's roll?" Sh..."
links.text: "You too -- Morell? Let's roll?" She smiles and they leave -- two old cryptozoologists and one gas-powered wheelchair.

links.title: You: ""I live to serve." (Tip an imaginar..."
links.text: "I live to serve." (Tip an imaginary police hat.)

links.title: You: "Just nod."
links.text: Just nod.

links.title: You: ""I'd offer to help, but I have my o..."
links.text: "I'd offer to help, but I have my own things to do." (Refuse.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course, sweetie. We couldn't as..."
links.text: "Of course, sweetie. We couldn't ask you to do more than you already have. Come now, Morell, we've waited so long, what's one more season?"

links.title: You: ""Damnit, maybe I can still restock..."
links.text: "Damnit, maybe I can still restock the trap for you?" (Accept.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You *can*?" The lieutenant makes a..."
links.text: "You *can*?" The lieutenant makes a show of suppressing a sigh. "Fine. It's better than having these people get pneumonia on the coast, but after *this*..."

links.title: Drama: "He wants to see this tale through a..."
links.text: He wants to see this tale through as much as *you*. Otherwise he'd have stopped this already. But he *cannot* let it drag out after this.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Really, it's too much, officer..."..."
links.text: "Really, it's too much, officer..." He starts coughing again.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""What Morell means is, we're gratef..."
links.text: "What Morell means is, we're grateful for your help." She nods to her husband.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Here's a fresh batch of locusts. T..."
links.text: "Here's a fresh batch of locusts. They should slide right down the funnel. And thank you again. We will definitely mention you, should this lead to a discovery. I'm not talking co-discovery, of course, but..."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Wow! Co-discovery? You'd be famous...."
links.text: Wow! Co-discovery? You'd be famous. You'd show them all. This *does* tingle the pleasure centre...

links.title: Authority: "This would *show* them all. We need..."
links.text: This would *show* them all. We need to get you on that list of discoverers, no question about that.

links.title: You: ""We've come too far to quit. I'm go..."
links.text: "We've come too far to quit. I'm gonna restock the trap. Lets *do* this." (Accept enthusiastically.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're getting *really* carried awa..."
links.text: "We're getting *really* carried away with this, aren't we?" He makes a show of suppressing a sigh. "Fine, it's better than having these people get pneumonia on the coast. But after this..."

links.title: You: ""Did *you* know Gary was hiding the..."
links.text: "Did *you* know Gary was hiding the armour?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Hell no, I had no idea. And I'm st..."
links.text: "Hell no, I had no idea. And I'm still cross with him to be honest. It's not like him. He's got his quirks, but dishonesty -- or disloyalty -- are not one of them."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Thanks," the man mutters in the di..."
links.text: "Thanks," the man mutters in the distance. He doesn't dare say more.

links.title: Empathy: "He's still glad his friend stood up..."
links.text: He's still glad his friend stood up for him.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I don't know what got into him, of..."
links.text: "I don't know what got into him, officer... Thank you for letting him off easy. He won't forget it; we'll make sure he won't."

links.title: You: ""Have you noticed anything *off* ab..."
links.text: "Have you noticed anything *off* about your friend Gary?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Huh? No. No, of course not. Why?""
links.text: "Huh? No. No, of course not. Why?"

links.title: You: ""Are you sure?""
links.text: "Are you sure?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Well..." He lowers his voice. "He'..."
links.text: "Well..." He lowers his voice. "He's been a little unenthusiastic about the trip. More so than usual. But that's understandable. He just wants to get home and warm up."

links.title: Empathy: "He doesn't want to say it, but this..."
links.text: He doesn't want to say it, but this *is* unusual. Gary's been to the jungle with him -- to places *way* more challenging than the coast. Why so eager to go home?

links.title: You: ""I'll get going." [Leave.]"
links.text: "I'll get going." [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Hello, officer! I think I almost h..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello, officer! I think I almost have it! A new trap design, that is! I know you're sceptical, but I have a good feeling about this."

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Hello! Lena and I were just discus..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello! Lena and I were just discussing the design of the new trap."

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Good to see you again, officer. To..."
dialogueTree.text: "Good to see you again, officer. To what do I owe the pleasure?"

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Ha ha, nothing like the gratitude..."
dialogueTree.text: "Ha ha, nothing like the gratitude of a good woman. Now, then, what can I do for you?" He gives you a gruff pat on the shoulder.

links.title: Empathy: "He tries to play it cool -- remain..."
links.text: He tries to play it cool -- remain professorial -- but inside, this man is itching for some news on those *traps*.

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I couldn't possibly shower thanks..."
dialogueTree.text: "I couldn't possibly shower thanks on you as enthusiastically as my wife has," he says with a friendly nod. "But I am grateful for your assistance, officer."

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""It's great to see you again, offic..."
dialogueTree.text: "It's great to see you again, officer!" He grins, bowing awkwardly. "My wife can't wait to thank you. Go on, talk to her."

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""We'll be on our way soon." He gets..."
dialogueTree.text: "We'll be on our way soon." He gets up. "Thank you again for lending a hand."

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Hello hello!" He gets up. "What ca..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello hello!" He gets up. "What can I do for you, officer?"

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""If you see Lena, tell her I won't..."
dialogueTree.text: "If you see Lena, tell her I won't be long," he says, getting up. "I'm so close to being done here..."

links.title: Empathy: "This is a man possessed, always on..."
links.text: This is a man possessed, always on the brink of some breakthrough. He won't leave if there's a sliver of hope *the Great Find* might happen today.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sir, your wife is waiting for you.""
links.text: "Sir, your wife is waiting for you."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I just have to do one more round,..."
links.text: "I just have to do one more round, see if the phasmid has taken the bait... Then we're going." He refastens a bit of netting that has come loose in the wind.

links.title: Interfacing: "His hands are large and weather-wor..."
links.text: His hands are large and weather-worn, but also used to delicate, precise work.

links.title: Volition: "For all his passion, this man is di..."
links.text: For all his passion, this man is diligent and patient. You could learn things from him.

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Hello hello!" He gets up. "What ca..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello hello!" He gets up. "What can I do for you, officer?"

links.title: You: ""I hope you haven't been littering..."
links.text: "I hope you haven't been littering here. This is unspoiled wilderness."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Wilderness?" He looks around. "You..."
links.text: "Wilderness?" He looks around. "You must be joking, officer."

links.title: You: ""You got me. But what *are* you doi..."
links.text: "You got me. But what *are* you doing here?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I'm looking for a rare insect, the..."
links.text: "I'm looking for a rare insect, the *Insulindian phasmid*. Field work -- nothing quite like it..."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "He's the kind of robust man who fee..."
links.text: He's the kind of robust man who feels most at home outdoors, doing strenuous work in places where most people wouldn't venture.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Morell, cryptozoologist. I'd shake..."
links.text: "Morell, cryptozoologist. I'd shake your hand, but..." He displays his gloved hands, which are glistening with sewage and silt.

links.title: You: ""I'm serious. I am here to make sur..."
links.text: "I'm serious. I am here to make sure adventurers aren't disturbing nesting areas."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I'm not an *adventurer*, I'm a *sc..."
links.text: "I'm not an *adventurer*, I'm a *scientist*. I know how to tread lightly and clean up after myself."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And we're not really the wildlife..."
links.text: "And we're not really the wildlife protection services."

links.title: You: ""Are you doing some kind of science..."
links.text: "Are you doing some kind of science here? You look like a science person."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""'A science person'?" He snarls. "T..."
links.text: "'A science person'?" He snarls. "The *so-called* science community hasn't accepted me as one of their own quite yet."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Doesn't sound like he particularly..."
links.text: Doesn't sound like he particularly wants to be lumped in with them either. His is a scientific community of one.

links.title: You: ""You're not here to hide a dead bod..."
links.text: "You're not here to hide a dead body, are you? I've been seeing a lot of dead bodies."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""No, officer. You've got the wrong..."
links.text: "No, officer. You've got the wrong person. I deal with *living* organisms."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""I'm Morell, a cryptozoologist. I'm..."
links.text: "I'm Morell, a cryptozoologist. I'm out here looking for a rare insect called the *Insulindian phasmid*. I'd shake your hand, but..." He displays his gloved hands, which are glistening with silt and sewage.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The way he said the word *phasmid*..."
links.text: The way he said the word *phasmid* made it sound full of mystery -- this is a very special word for him indeed.

links.title: You: ""You must be Lena's husband, Morell..."
links.text: "You must be Lena's husband, Morell. That's why you're here."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Yes, yes, I am." He looks at you w..."
links.text: "Yes, yes, I am." He looks at you with mild surprise, then quickly recovers --

dialogueTree.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Here we go. Nice and easy. No way..."
dialogueTree.text: "Here we go. Nice and easy. No way out, little guys, not out of this jam..."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: "There's a cylinder on the ground in..."
links.text: There's a cylinder on the ground in which the man is arranging some netting. It looks like some kind of trap. He notices you.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Who's there? Oh, the police. Hello..."
links.text: "Who's there? Oh, the police. Hello, officers."

links.title: Composure: "His self-conscious enthusiasm rende..."
links.text: His self-conscious enthusiasm renders his movements ungainly. He looks like your understanding of a scientist.

links.title: You: ""You must be Morell, the cryptozool..."
links.text: "You must be Morell, the cryptozoologist?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""To what do I owe the pleasure?""
links.text: "To what do I owe the pleasure?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "That's sarcasm. He takes no pleasur..."
links.text: That's sarcasm. He takes no pleasure from your appearance.

links.title: You: ""You don't seem too happy to see th..."
links.text: "You don't seem too happy to see the RCM."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Oh no, it's alright. I'm just busy..."
links.text: "Oh no, it's alright. I'm just busy." He glances at the cylinder. "What's this about?"

links.title: You: ""Lena sent me. She's been really wo..."
links.text: "Lena sent me. She's been really worried about you and is waiting for you to get back."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Ack! Of course. Thank you for pass..."
links.text: "Ack! Of course. Thank you for passing along the message. That damned water lock is broken, and we can't go all the way around the 8/81..."

links.title: You: ""Yeah. That was me. I broke the wat..."
links.text: "Yeah. That was me. I broke the water lock with my motor carriage. But it's fixed now. You can go back."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""You broke the water lock with a mo..."
links.text: "You broke the water lock with a motor carriage? But there was a billboard in the canal..." He looks south. "Not a vehicle. It said 'Samaran Butter.'"

links.title: You: ""No, see, I jumped *over* the canal..."
links.text: "No, see, I jumped *over* the canal in my motor carriage, *tearing* through the Samaran Butter Sign, which fell *into* the canal, blocking the gates. I used the pawnshop as a launch ramp."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Why?" He spreads his arms in disbe..."
links.text: "Why?" He spreads his arms in disbelief.

links.title: You: ""Because I needed to drive into the..."
links.text: "Because I needed to drive into the ocean."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Sure." He quickly comes to terms w..."
links.text: "Sure." He quickly comes to terms with this. "But you said the water lock is fixed now, so we can go back..."

links.title: You: ""Because I'm insane.""
links.text: "Because I'm insane."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Insane. Yes. Okay. Good." He quick..."
links.text: "Insane. Yes. Okay. Good." He quickly comes to terms with it. "But you said the water lock is fixed now, so we can go back..."

links.title: You: ""It was an *experiment* to gauge th..."
links.text: "It was an *experiment* to gauge the Coupris 40's aerial performance. I'm something of a gentleman scientist."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Scientist. Yes. Okay." He quickly..."
links.text: "Scientist. Yes. Okay." He quickly comes to terms with it. "But you said the water lock is fixed now, so we can go back..."

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry. I don't know.""
links.text: "I'm sorry. I don't know."

links.title: You: ""I guess you're right. It was reall..."
links.text: "I guess you're right. It was really the sign's fault. Anyway, you can go back now."

links.title: You: ""No, no, it was all me. I caused yo..."
links.text: "No, no, it was all me. I caused your delay, and I'm sorry. But you can return now."

links.title: You: ""The water lock's been fixed. It wa..."
links.text: "The water lock's been fixed. It was fine when I crossed it."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Oh good. We should really be getti..."
links.text: "Oh good. We should really be getting back. Gary could use a hot shower and a warm bed..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""DID HE SAY WE CAN GO BACK NOW?""
links.text: "DID HE SAY WE CAN GO BACK NOW?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""YES, GARY! WE CAN GO BACK SOON!" H..."
links.text: "YES, GARY! WE CAN GO BACK SOON!" He turns to you. "If you see Lena, tell her I won't be long now."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""YES, GARY! WE CAN GO SOON!" He tur..."
links.text: "YES, GARY! WE CAN GO SOON!" He turns to you. "If you see Lena, tell her I won't be long."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The 8/81 is a raised motorway that..."
links.text: The 8/81 is a raised motorway that separates Martinaise from Jamrock. The labyrinth of streets underneath it makes it difficult to pass. Not like walking over a nice water lock...

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Ack! Of course. Thank you for pass..."
links.text: "Ack! Of course. Thank you for passing along the message. That damned water lock is broken, and we can't go all the way around the 8/81..."

links.title: You: ""Man to man, you shouldn't leave yo..."
links.text: "Man to man, you shouldn't leave your wöman unattended in a cafeteria surrounded by *communists*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs at your flagra..."
links.text: The lieutenant sighs at your flagrant misogyny.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: "The cryptozoologist's companion say..."
links.text: The cryptozoologist's companion says nothing but nods approvingly in your direction.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Ack, so that's what this is." He i..."
links.text: "Ack, so that's what this is." He ignores your jab. "Lena sent you. Can't say I blame her -- we've been here for days. That damned water lock is broken, and we can't go under the 8/81..."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Ack, so that's what this is." He i..."
links.text: "Ack, so that's what this is." He ignores your jab. "Lena sent you. Can't say I blame her -- we've been here for days. That damned water lock is broken, and we can't go under the 8/81..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""MAYBE THE WATER LOCK IS FIXED!""
links.text: "MAYBE THE WATER LOCK IS FIXED!"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""We were supposed to go back to Mar..."
links.text: "We were supposed to go back to Martinaise a couple of days ago, but that damned water lock is broken." He gives a dismissive wave.

links.title: You: ""Yeah. That was me. I broke the wat..."
links.text: "Yeah. That was me. I broke the water lock with my motor carriage. But it's fixed now. You can go back."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""You broke the water lock with a mo..."
links.text: "You broke the water lock with a motor carriage? But there was a billboard in the canal..." He looks south. "Not a vehicle. It said 'Samaran Butter.'"

links.title: You: ""No, see, I jumped *over* the canal..."
links.text: "No, see, I jumped *over* the canal in my motor carriage, *tearing* through the Samaran Butter Sign, which fell *into* the canal, blocking the gates, as I landed on the other side. I used the pawnshop as a launch ramp."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Why?" He spreads his arms in disbe..."
links.text: "Why?" He spreads his arms in disbelief.

links.title: You: ""Because I needed to get to the oce..."
links.text: "Because I needed to get to the ocean."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Sure." He quickly comes to terms w..."
links.text: "Sure." He quickly comes to terms with this. "But you said the water lock is fixed now, so we can go back..."

links.title: You: ""I'm afraid I may be insane.""
links.text: "I'm afraid I may be insane."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Insane. Yes. Okay. Good." He quick..."
links.text: "Insane. Yes. Okay. Good." He quickly comes to terms with it. "But you said the water lock is fixed now, so we can go back..."

links.title: You: ""It was an *experiment* to gauge th..."
links.text: "It was an *experiment* to gauge the Coupris 44's aerial performance. I'm something of a gentleman scientist."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Scientist. Yes. Okay." He quickly..."
links.text: "Scientist. Yes. Okay." He quickly comes to terms with it. "But you said the water lock is fixed now, so we can go back..."

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry. I don't know.""
links.text: "I'm sorry. I don't know."

links.title: You: ""I guess you're right. It was reall..."
links.text: "I guess you're right. It was really the sign's fault. Anyway, you can go back now."

links.title: You: ""No, no, it was all me. I caused yo..."
links.text: "No, no, it was all me. I caused your delay, and I'm sorry. But you can go back now."

links.title: You: ""Either way, have a safe trip back!..."
links.text: "Either way, have a safe trip back!" [Leave.]

links.title: You: ""The water lock's been fixed. It wa..."
links.text: "The water lock's been fixed. It was fine when I crossed it."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Oh good. We should really be getti..."
links.text: "Oh good. We should really be getting back. Gary could use a hot shower and a warm bed..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""DID HE SAY WE CAN GO BACK NOW?""
links.text: "DID HE SAY WE CAN GO BACK NOW?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""YES, GARY! WE CAN GO BACK SOON!" H..."
links.text: "YES, GARY! WE CAN GO BACK SOON!" He turns to you.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""YES, GARY! WE CAN GO SOON!" He tur..."
links.text: "YES, GARY! WE CAN GO SOON!" He turns to you.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""We were supposed to go back to Mar..."
links.text: "We were supposed to go back to Martinaise a couple of days ago, but that damned water lock is broken." He gives a dismissive wave.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""We were supposed to go back to Mar..."
links.text: "We were supposed to go back to Martinaise a couple of days ago, but that damned water lock is broken." He gives a dismissive wave.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""IS THAT THE POLICE? WHY ARE THE PO..."
links.text: "IS THAT THE POLICE? WHY ARE THE POLICE HERE?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""DON'T WORRY, GARY. I'LL HANDLE IT.""
links.text: "DON'T WORRY, GARY. I'LL HANDLE IT."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Who's there? Oh, the police. Hello..."
links.text: "Who's there? Oh, the police. Hello, officer."
